sub_topic: The possibility of dark matter being composed of primordial black holes
message_1: What would be the estimated mass range of primordial black holes that could explain the observed dark matter content of the universe?
message_2:
Primordial black holes (PBHs) are hypothetical black holes that are thought to have formed in the early universe, shortly after the Big Bang. They have been proposed as a possible explanation for the observed dark matter content of the universe. To estimate the mass range of primordial black holes that could account for the dark matter, we need to consider various observational constraints and theoretical models.

The mass range of PBHs that could explain the observed dark matter content of the universe is still uncertain and subject to ongoing research.
